intro: Opilia sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered opilia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. Opilia sparsiflora typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky surfaces, thriving in humid, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and unique floral display.
